remixlab.dandelion.geom

Class Mat

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.dandelion.geom.Mat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Linkable, Copyable

    public class Mat
extends Object
implements Linkable
    4x4 matrix affine matrix implementation. Matrix is represented in column major order: | m0 m4 m8 m12 | | m1 m5 m9 m13 | | m2 m6 m10 m14 | | m3 m7 m11 m15 |

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float[] mat 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Mat()
      Constructor for an identity matrix.
      Mat(float[] data)
      Same as this(data, false).
      Mat(float[] data, boolean transposed)
      Sets the matrix contents from the 16 entry float array.
      Mat(float _m0, float _m1, float _m2, float _m3, float _m4, float _m5, float _m6, float _m7, float _m8, float _m9, float _m10, float _m11, float _m12, float _m13, float _m14, float _m15)
      16 consecutive values that are used as the elements of a 4 x 4 column-major matrix.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void apply(float[] source)
      Multiply this matrix by the 16 consecutive float array defined by source.

      Multiply this matrix by the 16 consecutive values that are used as the elements of a 4 x 4 column-major matrix.

      Multiply this matrix by the one defined from source.

      Multiply this matrix by the transposed matrix defined from the 16 consecutive float source array.

      Multiply this matrix by the 16 consecutive values that are used as the elements of a 4 x 4 row-major matrix.

      Returns a copy of this Matrix.

      Invert this matrix into m, i.e., doesn't modify this matrix.

      Share the src array data.

      Multiply a three or four element vector against this matrix.
      static Mat multiply(Mat a, Mat b)
      Returns a x b.
      static void multiply(Mat a, Mat b, Mat c)
      Define c as a x b.
      Vec multiply(Vec source)
      Same as return multiply(source, null).
      Vec multiply(Vec source, Vec target)
      Multiply this matrix by the source Vec and stores the result in the target Vec which is then returned.
      void preApply(float[] source)
      Pre-multiply this matrix by the 16 consecutive float array defined by source.
      void preApply(float m0, float m1, float m2, float m3, float m4, float m5, float m6, float m7, float m8, float m9, float m10, float m11, float m12, float m13, float m14, float m15)
      Pre-multiply this matrix by the 16 consecutive values that are used as the elements of a 4 x 4 column-major matrix.
      void preApply(Mat left)
      Pre-multiply this matrix by the one defined from source.
      void preApplyTransposed(float[] rowMajor)
      Pre-multiply this matrix by the transposed matrix defined from the 16 consecutive float rowMajor array.
      void preApplyTransposed(float n00, float n01, float n02, float n03, float n10, float n11, float n12, float n13, float n20, float n21, float n22, float n23, float n30, float n31, float n32, float n33)
      Pre-multiply this matrix by the 16 consecutive values that are used as the elements of a 4 x 4 row-major matrix.

      Print this matrix contents onto the console.

      Sets the identity matrix.

      Same as rotateZ(angle).
      void rotate(float angle, float v0, float v1, float v2)
      Multiply this matrix by the rotation matrix defined from the (v0,v1,v2) and angle.

      Multiply this matrix by the rotation around x-axis matrix defined from angle.

      Multiply this matrix by the rotation around z-axis matrix defined from angle.

      Multiply this matrix by the scaling matrix defined from s.

      Multiply this matrix by the scaling matrix defined from sx and sy.

      Multiply this matrix by the scaling matrix defined from x, y and z.

      Sets the column-major matrix contents from the given 16 consecutive values.

      Links array data representation with the source

      Sets the matrix contents from the src matrix contents.

      Sets the matrix contents from the given elements where first "index" is row, second is column, e.g., _m20 corresponds to the element located at the third row and first column of the matrix.
      void shearX(float angle)
      Multiply this matrix by the x-shearing matrix defined from angle.

      Same as translate(tx, ty, 0.

      Multiply this matrix by the translation matrix defined from tx, ty and tz.

      Transpose this matrix.

      • Mat

        public Mat(float[] data)
        Same as this(data, false).
        See Also:
        Mat(float[], boolean)

      • Mat

        public Mat(float[] data,
           boolean transposed)
        Sets the matrix contents from the 16 entry float array. If transpose is false the matrix contents are set in column major order, otherwise they're set in row-major order.

      • get

        public float[] get(float[] target)
        Copies the matrix contents into a 16 entry float array. If target is null (or not the correct size), a new array will be created.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Linkable

      • getTransposed

        public float[] getTransposed(float[] rowMajor)
        Copies the transposed matrix contents into a 16 entry float array. If target is null (or not the correct size), a new array will be created.

        public void setTransposed(float _m00,

                          float _m33)
        Sets the matrix contents from the given elements where first "index" is row, second is column, e.g., _m20 corresponds to the element located at the third row and first column of the matrix.

      • applyTransposed

        public void applyTransposed(float n00,
                            float n01,
                            float n02,
                            float n03,
                            float n10,
                            float n11,
                            float n12,
                            float n13,
                            float n20,
                            float n21,
                            float n22,
                            float n23,
                            float n30,
                            float n31,
                            float n32,
                            float n33)
        Multiply this matrix by the 16 consecutive values that are used as the elements of a 4 x 4 row-major matrix. First "index" is row, second is column, e.g., n20 corresponds to the element located at the third row and first column of the matrix.

        public void preApplyTransposed(float n00,

      • multiply

        public Vec multiply(Vec source)
        Same as return multiply(source, null).
        See Also:
        multiply(Vec, Vec)

      • multiply

        public Vec multiply(Vec source,
                    Vec target)
        Multiply this matrix by the source Vec and stores the result in the target Vec which is then returned.

      • multiply

        public float[] multiply(float[] source,
                        float[] target)
        Multiply a three or four element vector against this matrix. If out is null or not length 3 or 4, a new float array (length 3) will be returned.

      • transpose

        public void transpose()
        Transpose this matrix.

      • invert

        public boolean invert(Mat m)
        Invert this matrix into m, i.e., doesn't modify this matrix.

        m should be non-null.

      • invert

        public boolean invert()
        Invert this matrix.
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • determinant

        public float determinant()
        Returns:
        the determinant of the matrix

      • print

        public void print()
        Print this matrix contents onto the console.
